event.title: is projected to be 1,722 as of April 1, 2008

data.event: The population is projected to be 1,722 as of April 1, 2008.

event.title: thrived on the peninsula for thousands of years

data.event: As the ice melted and sea levels rose, these Native Americans ended up staying and thrived on the peninsula for thousands of years.
In 1527, a Spanish road map showed a settlement near the Rio de la Paz.

event.title: 150 years, the majority of the pre-Columbian Native American peoples of Florida had been mercilessly slaughtered

data.event: Within 150 years, the majority of the pre-Columbian Native American peoples of Florida had been mercilessly slaughtered.
